title: Lanzhou
summary: Lanzhou (UK: /lænˈdʒoʊ/, US: /lɒn-/;[5] simplified Chinese: 兰州; traditional Chinese: 蘭州; pinyin: Lánzhōu; Postal romanisation: Lan-chou[6]/Lan Chow) is the capital and largest city of Gansu Province in Northwest China.[7] Located on the banks of the Yellow River, it is a key regional transportation hub, connecting areas further west by rail to the eastern half of the country. Historically, it has been a major link on the Northern Silk Road and it stands to become a major hub on the New Eurasian Land Bridge. The city is also a center for heavy industry and petrochemical industry.
